description: The underlying cause of the issue described revolves around the insufficient space in the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) recovery partition, which can prevent the successful installation of update KB5034441. The update pertains specifically to Windows 10 version 22H2, introduced in January 2024. The problem may stem from existing configurations or low disk space that does not comply with the size requirements for the recovery partition. Guidance in KB5034441 notes the necessity to resize the recovery partition to ensure the system can handle the updates properly. Verification steps include checking the recovery partition's location and status, as well as confirming its size and available space using tools like Disk Management and PowerShell commands.
